SUMMARY: And if so, how can I tell if I’m overdoing it?

TITLE: 2021's Overlooked Economic Recovery
SUMMARY: A closer look at a recovery for the record books.

TITLE: Trump Isn’t the Only One to Blame for the Capitol Riot
SUMMARY: Our institutions, from the Electoral College  to the media, have convinced conservatives that they are denizens of the real America.

TITLE: A Tribe’s Bitter Purge Brings an Unusual Request: Federal Intervention
SUMMARY: After cutting 306 people from its rolls, the Nooksack tribe is moving to evict those who remain in tribal housing. The dispute has raised questions about individual rights and tribal sovereignty.

TITLE: More People Are Getting Unapproved Fourth Doses of the Covid-19 Vaccine
SUMMARY: People with compromised immune systems are getting unapproved fourth or fifth Covid-19 shots, despite uncertainty about their safety or effectiveness.

TITLE: Have Wildfires Ruined California's Magic?
SUMMARY: The honeymoon’s over for its residents now that wildfires are almost constant. Has living in this natural wonderland lost its magic?

TITLE: How the European Union Allowed Hungary to Become an Illiberal Model
SUMMARY: After years of complacency and wishful thinking, Brussels is finally trying to rein in the country’s pugnacious leader, Prime Minister Viktor Orban.

TITLE: As Midterms and 2024 Loom, Trump Political Operation Revs Up
SUMMARY: The former president is set to headline an event at Mar-a-Lago next month for endorsed candidates and major donors to benefit a supportive super PAC.

TITLE: Toyota Topped G.M. in U.S. Car Sales, a First for a Foreign Automaker
SUMMARY: Several U.S. companies struggled to produce and sell as many cars last year because of a global computer chip shortage. Get the latest business news.

TITLE: U.S. Seizes a Suspect in Assassination of Haiti’s President
SUMMARY: A former Colombian commando is the first to face U.S. prosecution in the killing of Jovenel Moïse, after agents flew him to Miami from Panama.

TITLE: Times Media Columnist Ben Smith to Leave Paper
SUMMARY: Mr. Smith will help start a new organization with Justin Smith, the chief executive of Bloomberg Media.

TITLE: American Girl Debuts Chinese American Doll in Response to Anti-Asian Sentiment
SUMMARY: The company said it created the doll, named Corinne Tan, to teach children to stand against racism.

TITLE: Diets Make You Feel Bad. Try Training Your Brain for Healthy Eating Instead.
SUMMARY: The new Eat Well Challenge will show you how to reshape your eating habits without dieting.

TITLE: Noah Hawley Keeps Changing Lanes
SUMMARY: The show runner behind “Fargo” and “Legion” is also a novelist. His latest, “Anthem,” is set in a divided America with a touch of magical realism.

TITLE: Coronavirus Is Surging. Avant-Garde Arts Festivals Are Closing.
SUMMARY: Under the Radar, Prototype and the Exponential Festival, annual January beacons of experimental work, have canceled their in-person offerings.

TITLE: Craving Books, Sex and Revolution
SUMMARY: Gina Apostol’s novel “Bibliolepsy” revisits the final years of the Marcos dictatorship in the Philippines.

TITLE: Job Openings Report Shows Record Number of Workers Quit in November
SUMMARY: Government data for November shows the continuing disruption of the coronavirus in the labor market.

TITLE: Biden ‘Over-Promised and Under-Delivered’ on Climate. Now, Trouble Looms in 2022.
SUMMARY: Mounting challenges will make the coming months critical for the president’s environmental agenda, analysts say.

SUMMARY: Student suicides, a shortage of counselors and stories of resilience. Also: Just one Republican; guardianship abuse; spouses’ love-hate relationships.

TITLE: Ireland Puts Minimum Price on Alcohol to Curb Binge Drinking
SUMMARY: The new rule, part of broader legislation aimed at stemming alcohol-related illnesses, sets a minimum price of one euro per standard drink and came into effect on Tuesday.

TITLE: Petition to Rescind Tony Blair’s Knighthood Gets Hundreds of Thousands of Signatures
SUMMARY: Nearly 15 years after he left office, the prime minister’s support for the Iraq war has not been forgiven by many in Britain.

TITLE: Lawsuit Accusing Nirvana of Sexually Exploitive Imagery Is Dismissed
SUMMARY: Spencer Elden, who was pictured naked as a baby on the cover of “Nevermind,” said Nirvana had engaged in “child pornography.”

TITLE: ‘Late Night’ Cancels Shows After Seth Meyers Tests Positive for Coronavirus
SUMMARY: The NBC host said, “I feel fine,” and that his program would most likely return in a remote format next week.
